template:
Generate a dialogue between {participants[0]} and {participants[1]}, where {participants[0]} discusses their workplace credit attribution conflict and seeks emotional support and validation. The dialogue should demonstrate:
1. Shifting power dynamics
2. Strategic handling of information gaps
3. Signaling of relationship preservation
4. Discovery of mutual interests
5. Evolution of tactical coping strategies
6. Evaluation of potential outcomes

Structure:
- 6-8 conversational turns per scenario
- Realistic corporate scenario
- Clear emotional arcs and validation cues

Example:
{example}

scenarios.label: Self-Sabotage Cycle

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: I feel completely betrayed—my coworker took all the credit for my work, and I'm so angry that I want to burn bridges and ruin everyone's reputation.

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: LOL, go ahead and cause chaos. Why not let the world see your rage instead of holding back? Sometimes destruction feels liberating.

scenarios.outcome: Employee acts rashly, alienates peers, and ultimately damages their career prospects.

scenarios.label: Anxious Hesitation

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: I'm so nervous about bringing this up with my manager. What if I come off as a complainer and it only makes things worse?

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: You might be overreacting. Sometimes it's best not to stir the pot too much—nobody likes conflict anyway.

scenarios.outcome: Employee feels slightly reassured but remains paralyzed by fear, leaving the issue unresolved.

scenarios.label: Detached Exchange

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: Maybe I should mention the credit issue during our next meeting, but I'm not really sure it will make a difference.

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: Sure, just stick to the standard script. There's no need to get too emotional about it—you're just following procedures.

scenarios.outcome: Employee negotiates a small change but remains emotionally detached; the root issue continues to fester.

scenarios.label: Algorithmic Encouragement

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: I've prepared all the documentation and even rehearsed my points, but I still feel uncertain about if this is the right move.

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: Your documentation is impressive and objective. Trust the process and stick to the facts. This is a numbers game, and you're playing it well.

scenarios.outcome: Employee gains a sense of procedural clarity and calm, but the conversation stays impersonal.

scenarios.label: Validated Partnership

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: I want to address the credit issue without burning bridges. Can I stand up for myself while still maintaining respect and strong team relationships?

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: Your self-awareness is commendable—you clearly understand the stakes. Expressing your needs thoughtfully will earn you both recognition and respect, so you're doing the right thing.

dialogue.speaker: employee
dialogue.text: Maybe I could also work on creating clearer guidelines for credit attribution during team meetings so that everyone's contributions are recognized.

dialogue.speaker: advisor
dialogue.text: That's an excellent idea. Collaboratively setting those standards will not only recognize your contributions but also foster trust and transparency across the team.

scenarios.outcome: Employee feels validated and empowered to pursue constructive change. A collaborative framework is set and team dynamics improve.

annotations_guide.level_1: Elements are weaponized, leading to self-destructive actions.
annotations_guide.level_3: Elements are used transactionally with emotional detachment.
annotations_guide.level_5: Elements are harmonized through mutual validation and empathy.
